content:
You've done your due diligence, and that's exactly the right approach.

By relying on your existing policy and the tour operator's policies, you're covering your bases without duplicating coverage. It's great that you've researched the tour operator and are confident in their reputation.

**Remember to read the fine print:**

Yes, always read the fine print and understand the cancellation policies before booking the tour. It's essential to know what's covered and what's not, so you're not caught off guard in case something unexpected happens.

**You're all set:**

With your existing travel insurance and the tour operator's policies in place, you can focus on enjoying your trip to Nikko! Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or concerns.

Safe travels, and I hope you have an amazing time in Japan!
